articles.headline: I.R.S. Moves to Tax Gifts to Groups Active in Politics
articles.snippet: Big donors may now owe gift taxes on their contributions to nonprofit advocacy groups that are playing an increasing role in American politics.
articles.abstract: Big donors may now owe gift taxes on their contributions to nonprofit advocacy groups that are playing an increasing role in American politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: Big donors like David H. Koch and George Soros could owe taxes on their millions of dollars in contributions to nonprofit advocacy groups that are playing an increasing role in American politics.

articles.headline: Disaster Plan Problems Found at U.S. Nuclear Plants
articles.snippet: A regulatory official said inspectors had found that some equipment installed after 9/11 to help American nuclear plants deal with emergencies was inoperable.
articles.abstract: A regulatory official said inspectors had found that some equipment installed after 9/11 to help American nuclear plants deal with emergencies was inoperable.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROCKVILLE, Md. — Despite repeated assurances that American nuclear plants are better equipped to deal with natural disasters than their counterparts in Japan, regulators said Thursday that recent inspections had found serious problems with some emergency equipment that would have made it unusable in an accident.

articles.headline: U.S. Inquiry of Google on Drug Ads
articles.snippet: Google said in a filing that it had set aside $500 million to pay a possible settlement of the inquiry.
articles.abstract: Google said in a filing that it had set aside $500 million to pay a possible settlement of the inquiry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators are investigating Google on suspicion of illegally displaying ads for online pharmacies that are operating outside the law, government officials said Thursday.

articles.headline: Uncertain Leadership Strains Financial Overhaul
articles.snippet: As temporary leaders overhaul regulations, concerns are rising about their vulnerability to political pressure.
articles.abstract: As temporary leaders overhaul regulations, concerns are rising about their vulnerability to political pressure.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When federal financial regulators next gather to compare notes and coordinate plans, one of the requirements of a banking law intended to prevent the next financial crisis, 5 of the 10 seats at the table will most likely be empty or filled by caretakers.

articles.headline: Pakistan Army Chief Balks at U.S. Demands to Cooperate
articles.snippet: Despite mounting pressure from the United States, Gen. Ashfaq Parvez Kayani seems unlikely to respond to American demands to root out other militant leaders.
articles.abstract: Despite mounting pressure from the United States, Gen. Ashfaq Parvez Kayani seems unlikely to respond to American demands to root out other militant leaders.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — Despite mounting pressure from the United States since the American raid that killed Osama bin Laden, Pakistan’s army chief, Gen. Ashfaq Parvez Kayani, seems unlikely to respond to American demands to root out other militant leaders, according to people who have met with him in the last 10 days.

articles.headline: Mighty Determined Sellers
articles.snippet: The publisher of Penthouse magazine and the United States Treasury find themselves in similar stock-sale situations this week.
articles.abstract: The publisher of Penthouse magazine and the United States Treasury find themselves in similar stock-sale situations this week.
articles.lead_paragraph: In real estate, there is such a thing as a motivated seller who wants out even if he must accept a very low price. That can produce bargains for buyers. Or perhaps the determination to sell means the seller knows something the buyer does not and wants out before others catch on.

articles.headline: Secret Archive of Ulster Troubles Faces Subpoena
articles.snippet: Authorities in the United Kingdom are seeking oral history accounts at Boston College that were made on the condition they be released only after the speakers’ deaths.
articles.abstract: Authorities in the United Kingdom are seeking oral history accounts at Boston College that were made on the condition they be released only after the speakers’ deaths.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the war in Northern Ireland was reaching its end in the late 1990s, two interviewers set out to collect memories of the conflict from men and women who had been involved as paramilitary fighters in some of the era’s most violent and grim episodes.
